whyStudy.title: Why Study in Russia?
whyStudy.description: Studying in Russia not only provides access to quality education but also offers a unique blend of cultural experiences, affordability, and a safe and supportive environment, making it an attractive choice for students looking to broaden their horizons and embark on a memorable academic journey.

collegeDetails.name: Mordovia State University
collegeDetails.address: 68 Bolshevistskaya St., Saransk, Republic of Mordovia, 430005, Russia

collegeDetails.name: Far Eastern Federal University
collegeDetails.address: 10 Ajax Bay St., Russky Island, Vladivostok, Russia, 690922

collegeDetails.name: North Ossetian State Medical Academy
collegeDetails.address: 44 Digorskoye Highway, Vladikavkaz, North Ossetia-Alania, Russia, 362021

collegeDetails.name: Northern west state , st petter burges State Medical University

requirement.title: Requirements for studying in Russia
requirement.description:
Eligibility criteria:

  • A score of 50% in 12th class
  • Minimum 18 years old
  • candidate s applying for MBBS must fulfil all the requirements in the guidelines of national medical commission (NMC)
  • Must have qualified NEET exam

Documents required:

  • Valid passport with a minimum validity of 1 year.
  • 10th &12th certificate
  • NEET qualified score card
  • Birth certificate, aadhar card, and PAN card
  • 3 passport size photographs

faqs.title: How much does it cost to study MBBS in Russia?
faqs.description: MBBS in Russia is one of the most affordable options for students considering MBBS abroad. Depending upon which university you have chosen, MBBS fees in Russia can vary anywhere between INR 15 Lakhs to INR 50 Lakhs for the entire MBBS course duration.

faqs.title: Is MBBS in Russia a good idea for Indian medical students?
faqs.description: Yes, studying MBBS in Russia is one of the best choices for all Indian students who, despite qualifying for the NEET exam, could not secure their seats in India. At times, even those who had a chance of studying MBBS in a private medical university often prefer studying MBBS in Russia as it promises a higher quality of education and is affordable.

faqs.title: Is NEET required for MBBS in Russia?
faqs.description: Yes, as per the current norms, any Indian student who aspires to become a doctor or even pursue medicine has to appear and qualify for the NEET exam. This is also mandatory for those who wish to study MBBS in Russia. A NEET score card is valid for three years, during which the students can apply to the university of their choice.

faqs.title: What after MBBS in Russia?
faqs.description: There are plenty of options and opportunities for the students once they complete their MBBS in Russia. They can choose to appear and qualify for the medical licensing exam of any country they plan to practise in, including India, or choose a specialisation or post-grad studies.

whyStudy.title: Why Study in Armenia?
whyStudy.description: Studying in Armenia not only provides access to quality education but also offers a unique blend of cultural experiences, affordability, and a safe and supportive environment, making it an attractive choice for students looking to broaden their horizons and embark on a memorable academic journey.

requirement.title: Requirements for studying in Armenia
requirement.description:
Eligibility criteria:

  • A score of 50% in 12th class
  • Minimum 18 years old
  • candidates applying for MBBS must fulfil all the requirements in the guidelines of national medical commission (NMC))
  • Must have qualified NEET exam

Documents required:

  • Valid passport with a minimum validity of 1 year.
  • 10th &12th certificate
  • NEET qualified score card
  • Birth certificate, aadhar card, and PAN card
  • 3 passport size photographs

faqs.title: How much does it cost to study MBBS in Armenia?
faqs.description: The cost of studying MBBS in Armenia varies depending on the university and the program, but it typically ranges from 1.75 lakhs to 3 lakhs INR per year.

faqs.title: Is MBBS in Armenia a good idea for Indian medical students?
faqs.description: MBBS in Armenia can be a good option for Indian medical students who are looking for a high-quality education at an affordable price. The universities in Armenia are accredited by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Medical Council of India (MCI), and the degrees they offer are recognized worldwide.

faqs.title: Is NEET required for MBBS in Armenia?
faqs.description: No, NEET is not required for MBBS in Armenia. However, students must have passed their 10+2 with at least 50% marks in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology. They may also be required to take an entrance exam.

faqs.title: What after MBBS in Armenia?
faqs.description: After completing MBBS in Armenia, Indian students can either return to India and practice medicine or continue their studies in a postgraduate program. They can also work in other countries, as the degrees they earn in Armenia are recognized worldwide.

requirement.description:
Eligibility criteria:

  • A score of 50% in 12th class
  • Minimum 18 years old
  • candidates applying for MBBS must fulfil all the requirements in the guidelines of national medical commission (NMC))
  • Must have qualified NEET exam

Documents required:

  • Valid passport with a minimum validity of 1 year.
  • 10th &12th certificate
  • NEET qualified score card
  • Birth certificate, aadhar card, and PAN card
  • 3 passport size photographs

faqs.title: How much does it cost to study MBBS in Kazakhstan?
faqs.description: The cost of studying MBBS in Kazakhstan varies depending on the university and the program, but it typically ranges from 15 lakhs to 50 lakhs INR per year.

faqs.title: Is MBBS in Kazakhstan a good idea for Indian medical students?
faqs.description: MBBS in Kazakhstan can be a good option for Indian medical students who are looking for a high-quality education at an affordable price. The universities in Kazakhstan are accredited by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Medical Council of India (MCI), and the degrees they offer are recognized worldwide.

faqs.title: Is NEET required for MBBS in Kazakhstan?
faqs.description: Yes, NEET is required for MBBS in Kazakhstan. However, students who have qualified NEET in the previous 3 years can apply for admission without having to take the Kazakhstan entrance exam.

faqs.title: What after MBBS in Kazakhstan?
faqs.description: After completing MBBS in Kazakhstan, Indian students can either return to India and practice medicine or continue their studies in a postgraduate program. They can also work in other countries, as the degrees they earn in Kazakhstan are recognized worldwide.
